intro: Begonia calcicola, commonly known as the limestone begonia, is a species native to rocky and arid environments. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water in its native habitat. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare and hardy plant.
